radiographic_examinations.findings: Nodular areas of consolidation throughout both lungs, some with calcification. Larger opacities in the upper lobes, up to 2.6 cm by 1.7 cm by 1.9 cm; soft-tissue fullness in the mediastinum, hila, and left axilla suggesting lymphadenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: One week later, CT with contrast showed mild prominence of hilar lymph nodes and large nodules with ill-defined and spiculated margins, some calcified.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Ill-defined nodular infiltrates, predominantly in the middle- and upper-lung zones, and ill-defined hilar markings.
